item.title: Markdown is the standard forma
item.author: e@mail.qom (Jane Doe)
item.description:
Markdown is the standard format par excellence for managing notes.

Notes? Yes, notes, like the ones you use to remember your study notes or your reminders.

But Salvador, we’re here to learn how to develop cutting-edge tools… why focus on simple notes???

The Markdown format allows you to store content and enrich it with simple tags. It doesn’t require compilers or sophisticated tools to edit or reproduce it. It’s like an HTML file, but with a much simpler syntax that is visually clear to the human eye. When it’s interpreted by a Markdown viewer, you can obtain the same results as with HTML, and you can also add JavaScript.

Introduction to Static Serverless Websites

Static serverless websites represent a modern trend in computing known as JAMstack (JavaScript, APIs, and Markup). This approach enables the creation of fast, secure, and scalable websites without the need to manage traditional servers.

Instead of relying on a server to generate dynamic content, static websites use pre-rendered files (HTML, CSS, and JavaScript) hosted on cloud services such as Netlify, Vercel, or GitHub Pages. item.title: That's right, Babelfish will b
item.author: e@mail.qom (Jane Doe)
item.description:
That’s right, Babelfish will be an additional layer over QL1. The most critical and permanent data will be recorded on the QL1 mainnet, and computational operations (processes) can be executed on Babelfish like an operating system.

Something like a Layer 2, focused on computing.

Thus, QL1 will remain optimal and cost-effective, as it won’t have to manage additional computational processes.

item.title: It seems you've found a key po
item.author: e@mail.qom (Jane Doe)
item.description:
It seems you’ve found a key point.

Indeed, Babelfish doesn’t yet implement IPv6, so it will only work when the communication channel is through IPv4.

Babelfish starts its local DNS server and assigns it a local IP address and configures the computer’s network interface to use its own DNS server.

If DNS requests are made to our server, everything works fine; but if the system or browsers have more options (access to other DNS servers), they will try to use the others, primarily prioritizing the fastest one, in this case, IPv6, regardless of whether the DNS server is correctly resolving the domain name or not.

item.title: Leveraging BabelFish Protocol
item.author: e@mail.qom (Jane Doe)
item.description:
Leveraging BabelFish Protocol for Custom Domains

The BabelFish protocol allows you to connect custom domains to any location on the internet or blockchain.

The BabelFish dashboard offers tools for hosting and managing web content directly on the blockchain. However, it’s important to inform the community about the different hosting options available.

GitHub Pages is an excellent example of a free platform where you can host websites and easily connect them to a custom domain using the BabelFish protocol.

item.title: You might want to click the 'S
item.author: e@mail.qom (Jane Doe)
item.description:
You might want to click the ‘Sync’ button on your dashboard, just in case the node hasn’t performed its automatic sync yet.

Every so often, the node checks for changes; usually, every 5 minutes. The Sync button is there to force the check, so you don’t have to wait for the automatic update to see any changes.
